)  = 465 25. Let A = {1, 2, 3}. The number of relations on A, containing (1, 2) and (2, 3), which are reflexive and transitive but not symmetric, is ______. Ans. (3) Sol. Transitivity (1, 2)  R, (2, 3)  R  (1, 3)  R For reflexive (1, 1), (2, 2) (3, 3)  R Now (2, 1), (3, 2), (3, 1) (3, 1) cannot be taken (1) (2, 1) taken and (3, 2) not taken (2) (3, 2) taken and (2, 1) not taken (3) Both not taken therefore 3 relations are possible. ALLEN

questions.text: If u and v satisfy the equations u + v = 18, u + v = 20, then u + v equals : (1) 5 (2) 4 (3) 3 (4) 8
questions.formattedText: If u and v satisfy the equations u + v = 18, u + v = 20, then u + v equals : (1) 5 (2) 4 (3) 3 (4) 8
questions.latexText: \(If u and v satisfy the equations u + v = 18, u + v = 20, then u + v equals : (1) 5 (2) 4 (3) 3 (4) 8\)

questions.text: If B = adj(adj(2A)), then the value of |B| + trace (B) equals: (1) 56 (2) 132 (3) 174 (4) 280
questions.formattedText: If B = adj(adj(2A)), then the value of |B| + trace (B) equals: (1) 56 (2) 132 (3) 174 (4) 280
questions.latexText: \(If B = \text{adj}(adj(2A)), then the value of \det(B) + trace (B) equals: (1) 56 (2) 132 (3) 174 (4) 280\)
